metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4744 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A double-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s TUN/TAP device driver functionality in how a user registers the device when the register_netdevice function fails (NETDEV_REGISTER notifier). This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
